sentence.Network_en: The helicopter lifted up the steel pylon, transported it to the site, and dropped it gently into place.

sentence.Network_en: Erection of the pylon required a crane of 1000 ton capacity.
sentence.Network_cn: 塔架安装需用起重量达1000吨的吊机.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from Greek pulōn, from pulē 'gate'

entry.def: Pylons are very tall metal structures which hold electric cables high above the ground so that electricity can be transmitted over long distances.

means.word_mean: 1. a tower for guiding pilots or marking the turning point in a race
2. a large vertical steel tower supporting high-tension power lines;

sentences.sentence: "power pylons are a favorite target for terrorists"
